results.title: Dollars or decay
results.creator_credit: Department of Health Services and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Illustrates the consequences that a poor or bad diet has on teeth. Attention is especially drawn to food served in school tuckshops. Section on good nutrition habits and how to give children low cost healthy food that they like.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Department of Health Services and Tasmanian Film Corporation

results.title: Dog's heaven
results.creator_credit: H Tyrlova and Short Film Studio
results.brief_description: Using wool fibre, a flexible material for animation, this film tells the story of a little black dog, slightly disappointed in his master, who has a brief sojourn in Dog’s Heaven. Instrumentation comes from three harpists, trumpeters, double bassists and a chorus.

results.title: The Dogfish as a vertebrate
results.brief_description: Deals with the Dogfish as a typical vertebrate, illustrating its anatomy in detail. Comparisons with four other types are given; i.e., with newt, lizard, bird and rabbit. Fishes, amphibians, reptiles, birds and mammals included in vertebrates; basic plan demonstrated by Dogfish. Alimentary canal has mouth, oesophagus, stomach, intestinal colonic regions; liver and pancreas; also central nervous system, sense organs. Detail from Dogfish; comparisons in the other four types (frog, lizard, bird and rabbit). Skeleton - axial and appendicular - common to all. Respiratory system involves large surfaces for oxygenation of blood - gills, lungs. Ventral position of heart; plans of blood systems. Gills as embryonic vestiges. Urinogenital systems association. Sexual reproduction and separate sexes common to vertebrates; detail for Dogfish (internal fertilization), Frog (external fertilization).

results.title: Dodging the column
results.brief_description: The transporting of a distillation column, 137 feet long, 500 miles by road from Greenwich to Grangemouth in Scotland. The commentary, spoken by the rigger in charge and one of the tractor drivers, expresses the humour and resourcefulness with which these transport workers tackle their job. The camera has captured moments of beauty as well as some amusing episodes in this journey of the longest load to travel by road in England.

results.title: Documentary of achievement
results.brief_description: The story of the development of the South African Iron and Steel Industrial Corporation. The film illustrates the growth of the vast iron and steel company and shows the part it has played in the development of South Africa through two generations in both peace and war. Contains excellent footage of construction of vehicles and ammunition for the war and some spectacular dangerous footage as well.

results.title: Documentary
results.creator_credit: Herman J. Engel, Sonya Friedman and Texture Films
results.brief_description: A compilation film of major sequences from famous documentaries. Each sequence offers an important example of documentary style, content and construction. A brief introduction prior to each segment provides a historical context. This film is also available for loan in 3 parts: 1922-1939 (506297), 1935-1955 (506298), 1948-1976 (506299).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Herman J. Engel, Sonya Friedman and Texture Films

results.title: Do you remember?
results.creator_credit: Tony Thompson and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: Day in, day out, throughout the year, the passengers on London’s buses and Underground leave behind them enough property to keep a large staff of sorters and storemen permanently busy. How the lost property is collected, sorted, ware-housed and, in most cases, restored to owners is the story of this film.

results.title: Do you ever wonder?
results.creator_credit: Gary Baker, Jerry Harned and Johnson-Nyquist Productions
results.brief_description: A film exploring the identity problems faced by young people built around four soft rock songs, which provide the only commentary. A father, trying to bridge the generation gap, attempts to reach an understanding with his son; a young girl trying to find herself, asks if anyone would care if she resigned from the human race; and the final segment, performed by a mime, illustrates how people build walls around themselves.
